timeline.bodyText:
queryParams.contains("comp=blocklist") is redundant isn't it?
Might be safer to require a blockid= as well if we just see a comp=block just to make sure we're in line with expectations on the API requests we'll see here?
timeline.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: You're right, I've just added an additional condition to ensure that we're really matching against a PutBlock request. Thanks!
replies.author: fcofdez

timeline.bodyText: Sam as in the production code, matching on comp=blocklist seems redundant when matching comp=block?
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Semi-related to this PR since you did it in the new collector, let's add assertions in spots like this one to make sure, we're actually seeing a GET here :) Can probably do the same for the list collector also.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.message: Don't rely on query params order for testing.
